title: Sound Art
name: Sound Art
description:
A Map by Hive

Mapping intentional art installations as well as small accidental audio nuances, this is open for anyone to post about sounds that inspire or challenge us.

properties.name: Echo Chamber
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing George Bush International, Terminal CThere is a dome in the ceiling in the center of this corridor crossroads. If you stand in the center of it, the sounds of people moving through are amplified more and more the closer they get to the center. I particularly like this piece of airport art because it causes about one out of 50 people (maybe fewer) to stop in the most unlikely spot in the airport for anyone to ever stop. Also at George Bush International Airport: Bookstore OutletsFox News Store

properties.name: Echo Chamber Sculpture
properties.description: Posted by Hive  Laurelhurst Park, NE Portland, ORA large steel sculpture that is a natural echo box. In fact, once i strapped a custom backless guitar to this thing so that IT became the sound box of the guitar. Watch out in summer, it can get hot.

properties.name: Galapagos Art Space and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Jason  70 N 6th St, Williamsburg, Brooklyn, NYCinematically inclined bar with stage and private performance space. Buddy Johnnie E. used to work here while doing his travelling cinema, I lived just blocks away, we\'d explore the empty 50K gallon mayonnaise vats dangling from the ceiling and walk the catwalks undetected by the drinking patrons below. Other good memories include the Burlesque Humour Acrobatics of the Pontani Sisters, a very intimate performance by the Rachels and an inspiring show by the Tracktenberg Family Slide Show Players (with the 9 year old drummer). That back room is also notorious for about 20 very loudly breaking beer glasses, especially during movie events (that i\'d always try to scam free tix to with carrie).

properties.name: Kids turn teen repellent sound into teacher-proof ringtone
properties.description: Posted by Jason  swindon, ukThe sound that repels troublemakers A device emitting a soundwave which is designed to drives young troublemakers away from a problem area of Swindon has been hailed as a success. Listen to the sound online. The \'Mosquito\' sonic deterrent device was installed by the Wyvern Theatre in an attempt to stop groups of up to 100 youngsters from gathering around Theatre Square. The Wyvern Theatre The Wyvern Theatre It was named the \'Mosquito\' because the sound resembles that of a buzzing insect. And it works by emitting a harmless ultra sonic tone that generally can only be heard by people aged 25 and under. In trials, it has proven that the longer someone is exposed to the sound, the more annoying it becomes.

properties.name: La Monte Young and Marian Zazeela's Dream House
properties.description: Posted by Hive 275 Church Street, new york, ny (tribeca)This subtly lit apartment filled with soft carpet, gently drifting shadowy mobiles and roomfulls of tremendously huge speakers, is a sound experiment/piece that blasts you with audio sine waves, letting the sounds bounce and fill the rooms with a network of sound, a field of sound. The field is modified by any variations in it\'s rippling texture, so if you walk around, you are \'playing\' the sound as an instrument. This is an amazing place to trip out and float in space. Open September 22-June 22 each year, Thursdays and Saturdays, 2 p.m. to midnight. Good review from the Village Voice - http://www.villagevoice.com/specials/bestof/2001/detail.php?id=3026 (212) 925-8270

properties.name: Radio Static
properties.description: Posted by MicropopetahThe in-between stationsTo help him get to sleep at night, Micropopetah likes to turn his radio to in-between two stations and listen to the mix of music and static.

properties.name: Urban frog symphony #1
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle PortlandWhen I stand here on quiet nights I hear a symphony of frogs croaking. I think they are coming from Oaks Bottom. http://www.platial.com/place/33459

properties.name: Urban frog symphony #2
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle PortlandWhen I get out of a movie at Laurelhurst I hear a symphony of frogs croaking. I think they reside in playing fields behind the school.

properties.name: Urban glacier
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle3031 SE Powell Blvd, Portland, OR 97202There is a parking lot located under the bowling alley on SE Powell. From there the sounds of rolling bowling balls and crashing pins remind me of tumbling boulders as they roll around a glacier. The muted thunder is comforting.

properties.name: [silence] art show
properties.description: Posted by Jason 59 Franklin St., NYC, NY.This exhibition focuses on artists\' uses of and responses to silence - as manifested in sculpture, installation, composition, works on paper, and time-based practices. The works on view, all created in the last ten years, address the futility of the chase, the beauty of absence, and the rich potential of an empty signal.SOUND PROGRAM PUBLIC EVENTS 4:33 pm, a series of Saturday afternoon performances: February 10th - Michelle Nagai February 17th - Michael Graeve and Tianna Kennedy February 24th - 31 Down

properties.name: amazing drum beat from construction noises
properties.description: Posted by Weptdowntown portlandi was walking with my manager to our colocation place, and a nearby construction crew was using one of those things (i have no idea what it\'s called) that is basically a huge pole that goes up and down via air pressure to smash things into the ground, or to level ground. since it was pneumatic, it made an very loud SSHHHHHHHH sound every time the thing went up, and of course made a rather incredible sound when it hit whatever metal it was driving into the ground. this is a somewhat common sound downtown. however while we were walking, we came across this specific area where the timing of the construction noises and the echoes off of the buildings came together in perfect unison to create one of the most amazing drum beats ive ever heard. my manager at the time was talking to me about something or other and i just told him to stop talking and i stopped there and enjoyed it for the few brief moments that it lasted. it was incredible - i was speechless. my manager thought i was nuts.

properties.name: meeting point for Boombox Parade - Phil Kline's Unsilent Night
properties.description: Posted by Hive   Near the Arch - Washington Square Park, ManhattanAn amazing wintery wonderland of audio ricochet and reverberating frequencies mixed with that NYC DIY parade impulse. 100\'s of people with 100\'s of boomboxes all playing slightly different parts of a special ambient orchestral sound piece, this is not to be missed!

properties.name: raccoons
properties.description: Posted by Hive

properties.name: the wave organ
properties.description: Posted by Tooldiva  San FranciscoThe wave organ was built as a project for the exploratorium in San Francisco. It\'s an amphitheater on the shore of the San Francisco bay. The seats are made from recycled city cement from demolished curbs or graveyard stones. The sound is provided by the bay - tubes extend from underwater to the amphitheater. If you sit very quietly, a sloshing symphony will fill your ears. I hear the best time to experience it is early in the morning. To find the wave organ, follow the shoreline north of the exploratorium. You will come to a marina, and you walk out on a little piece of land - it looks like you\'re just going to a yacht club, (it\'s near Yacht Road, in fact) but you will have to trust and when you see a yellow diamond sign that says "not a through street" you are getting close.

properties.name: tiny noises
properties.description: Posted by Tooldivathere\'s a house between Mason and Skidmore on NE 17th Ave. that has two tiny birch trees in the parking strip. The house is on the west side of 17th Ave. If you lean up close to them on a dry, windy day, you will hear the most delicate sound of the curled papery bark rustling.

properties.name: tiny noises
properties.description: Posted by TooldivaThis is one of many Benson Bubblers in Portland. The story goes that Simon Benson, A developer in Portland around the early 1900\'s put in around 25 of these drinking fountains around town so his workers wouldn\'t drink alcohol in the middle of the day. They make a really nice bloopy sound if you lean in close on a quiet night.

properties.name: tiny noises
properties.description: Posted by TooldivaIf you stand on the corner outside the Portland Outdoor Store on a quiet night, there is an unusual whistling sound that is made by the motor of this classic neon sign. At the bottom of the sign, there\'s an element that\'s supposed to look like a cattle brand and on one side you can read that it says "the best brands" inside the neon frame. (on the other side the text has worn off.) The sign whistles when the light is off, then it\'s silent when the red branding iron lights up again.
